properties.areaDesc: Michigan Waters of Lake Erie from Detroit River to North Cape MI
properties.headline: Low Water Advisory issued January 18 at 3:19PM EST until January 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...During the Gale Warning, expect sustained winds up to
25 knots from the west with gusts up to 36 knots. The largest
significant waves will be 4 feet with a potential maximum wave
height of 5 feet. During the Low Water Advisory, abnormally
low water levels expected.

* WHERE...Michigan Waters of Lake Erie from Detroit River to
North Cape MI.

* WHEN...The maximum winds are expected around 2 AM EST Sunday
with the largest waves expected around 3 PM EST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous waves which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility. Below normal
water levels will result in hazardous navigating conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As of 9:50 AM EST Saturday, the water level
at Toledo was 63 inches above low water datum, or 39 inches
above the critical mark for safe navigation. Strong west winds
over the western basin of Lake Erie are expected to cause water
levels to drop below the critical mark late this afternoon
through late Sunday morning.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

Mariners should navigate shallow waters with extreme caution due
to below normal water levels.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY... ...LOW WATER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST SUNDAY
